CatDescriptText: Mr. Fulton Stewart, postal employee, Hill District and Mr. Steward Haney, high school student, Uptown, were part of the "Pittsburghers Speak Up" column published in the Pittsburgh Courier Newspaper, August 19, 1961, pg. 7 with question: "what action, if any, should be taken and by whom, when Negro members of integrated teams refuse to play before segregated crowds?"  Mr. Stewart's answer reads: "Owners of the teams should back the players. True sports fans will turn out to see the game regardless of the seating arrangements."  Mr. Haney's answer reads: "The men should go ahead and play wherever they are supposed to play.  The segregation shouldn't make any difference to them."
TitMainTitle: Two frames: Portrait of Fulton Stewart wearing plaid suit jacket and hat, standing in front of ribbed metal wall; Portrait of Steward Haney wearing checkered shirt and bandaged hand, standing with arms crossed in front of ribbed metal wall
